## ğŸ§¹ Nettoyage des DonnÃ©es {.smaller}

::: {.panel-tabset}

### Correction Format

```{webr-r}
#| echo: true
# Correction des inversions Age/Gender
data_clean <- data_raw %>%
  mutate(
    age_numeric = suppressWarnings(as.numeric(Age)),
    gender_char = as.character(Gender),
    
    age_corrected = ifelse(is.na(age_numeric), as.numeric(gender_char), age_numeric),
    gender_corrected = ifelse(is.na(age_numeric), Age, gender_char),
    
    gender_is_numeric = suppressWarnings(!is.na(as.numeric(Gender))),
    
    age_final = ifelse(gender_is_numeric, as.numeric(Gender), age_corrected),
    gender_final = ifelse(gender_is_numeric, Age, gender_corrected),
    
    gender_final = case_when(
      tolower(gender_final) %in% c("male", "m") ~ "Male",
      tolower(gender_final) %in% c("female", "f") ~ "Female",
      tolower(gender_final) %in% c("non-binary", "nb") ~ "Non-binary",
      TRUE ~ as.character(gender_final)
    )
  ) %>%
  select(
    user_id = User_ID,
    age = age_final,
    gender = gender_final,
    platform = Platform,
    daily_usage_time_minutes = `Daily_Usage_Time (minutes)`,
    posts_per_day = Posts_Per_Day,
    likes_received_per_day = Likes_Received_Per_Day,
    comments_received_per_day = Comments_Received_Per_Day,
    messages_sent_per_day = Messages_Sent_Per_Day,
    dominant_emotion = Dominant_Emotion
  )

cat("âœ… Colonnes standardisÃ©es:", paste(names(data_clean), collapse = ", "))
```

### Filtrage

```{webr-r}
#| echo: true
# Nettoyage et validation
data <- data_clean %>%
  mutate(
    age = as.numeric(age),
    gender = factor(gender),
    platform = factor(platform),
    dominant_emotion = factor(dominant_emotion)
  ) %>%
  filter(
    !is.na(age), !is.na(daily_usage_time_minutes),
    age >= 18 & age <= 70,
    daily_usage_time_minutes >= 10 & daily_usage_time_minutes <= 480
  )

cat("ğŸ“‰ Observations initiales:", nrow(data_clean), "\n")
cat("âœ… Observations finales:", nrow(data), "\n")
cat("ğŸ—‘ï¸ Observations exclues:", nrow(data_clean) - nrow(data), "(", 
    round((nrow(data_clean) - nrow(data))/nrow(data_clean)*100, 1), "%)\n")
```

### Variables DÃ©rivÃ©es

```{webr-r}
#| echo: true
# CrÃ©ation de variables analytiques

    # CatÃ©gories d'usage
    usage_level = case_when(
      daily_usage_time_minutes < 60 ~ "Faible (<1h)",
      daily_usage_time_minutes < 120 ~ "ModÃ©rÃ© (1-2h)",
      daily_usage_time_minutes < 180 ~ "Ã‰levÃ© (2-3h)",
      TRUE ~ "TrÃ¨s Ã©levÃ© (>3h)"
    ),
    usage_level = factor(usage_level, 
                        levels = c("Faible (<1h)", "ModÃ©rÃ© (1-2h)", 
                                  "Ã‰levÃ© (2-3h)", "TrÃ¨s Ã©levÃ© (>3h)")),
    
    # Groupes d'Ã¢ge
    age_group = cut(age, breaks = c(18, 25, 30, 35, 70),
                   labels = c("18-25", "26-30", "31-35", "36+")),
    
    # Score d'engagement

                      (likes_received_per_day / 10) +

    # Variable binaire cible

cat("âœ… Variables crÃ©Ã©es: usage_level, age_group, engagement_score, anxiety_binary\n")
```

## ğŸ”¬ Segmentation : 3 Profils d'Utilisateurs {.smaller}

```{webr-r}
#| echo: false
#| fig-width: 12
#| fig-height: 6

library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

cat("CLUSTERING DES PROFILS D'UTILISATION\n")

# PrÃ©paration des donnÃ©es pour le clustering
cluster_data <- data %>%
  dplyr::select(
    daily_usage_time_minutes,
    posts_per_day,
    engagement_score,
    age
  ) %>%
  scale()  # Standardisation

# MÃ©thode du coude pour dÃ©terminer k optimal
cat("ğŸ” 1. DÃ‰TERMINATION DU NOMBRE OPTIMAL DE CLUSTERS:\n")
wss <- sapply(1:10, function(k) {
  kmeans(cluster_data, centers = k, nstart = 25)$tot.withinss
})

elbow_plot <- data.frame(k = 1:10, wss = wss)
p9 <- ggplot(elbow_plot, aes(x = k, y = wss)) +
  geom_line(color = "steelblue", linewidth = 1) +
  geom_point(color = "steelblue", size = 3) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 3, linetype = "dashed", color = "red", alpha = 0.5) +
  labs(
    title = "MÃ©thode du coude pour la sÃ©lection de k",
    subtitle = "RÃ©duction marginale de la variance intra-cluster",
    x = "Nombre de clusters (k)",
    y = "Somme des carrÃ©s intra-cluster"
  ) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = 1:10) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face = "bold"))

print(p9)

# Application du clustering avec k=3
cat("\nğŸ¯ 2. APPLICATION DU CLUSTERING AVEC k=3:\n")
set.seed(123)
kmeans_result <- kmeans(cluster_data, centers = 3, nstart = 25)
data$cluster <- as.factor(kmeans_result$cluster)

# Profil des clusters
cluster_profile <- data %>%
  group_by(cluster) %>%
  summarise(
    n = n(),
    avg_age = round(mean(age), 1),
    avg_usage = round(mean(daily_usage_time_minutes), 0),
    avg_posts = round(mean(posts_per_day), 1),
    avg_engagement = round(mean(engagement_score), 1),
    anxiety_rate = round(mean(anxiety_binary) * 100, 1),
    .groups = "drop"
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    size_percent = round(n / sum(n) * 100, 1),
```
